intro: Zuckia arizonica, commonly known as Arizona zuckia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, rounded fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Zuckia arizonica is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
